--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "djmc112003" <djmc112003@y...> wrote:
> Hi,
> Would anyone know why I'm getting the following error when trying to
> run one test in Junit? It runs perfectly well under another project
> (which has a different set of libraries). Here's the error:
> 
> Cannot instantiate test(s): java.lang.reflect.
InvocationTargetException
> 
> Thanks

JUnit cuts the stack traces when an exception occurs before 
instantiating your TestCase class. Thus the exception must have 
occurred during the field initializations. To see the stack traces of 
the actual exception, write a main method that instantiates your 
TestCase class but doesn't call the JUnit framework. So you might 
diagnose the root cause of the exception.

Best regards,

Mert Nuhoglu
